meanings.definition: A person who performs better or achieves more success than expected.
meanings.sent1: In the spelling bee, the overachievers knew all the words before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The overachievers in the class always scored the highest on tests.
meanings.sent3: The overachievers in the marathon finished the race in record time.
meanings.sent4: The team of overachievers surpassed all expectations and won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The overachievers' dedication and hard work paid off with their impressive results.

meanings.definition: To excel in a particular field or activity beyond what is considered normal or necessary.
meanings.sent1: She always overachieves in math class, solving problems quickly and accurately.
meanings.sent2: The team overachieves in every game, surprising their opponents with their skills.
meanings.sent3: The plant overachieves in growth, reaching new heights in just a few weeks.
meanings.sent4: The student overachieves in art, creating masterpieces that amaze everyone.
meanings.sent5: The company overachieves in innovation, constantly introducing groundbreaking ideas.
